title: Gauss law - 3 nC charges inside and outside cube

content.question: The figure shows two point charges and a closed surface in the shape of a cube. A <math alttext="positive 3.0 nanocoulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>+</mo><mn>3.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>nC</mtext></mstyle></math> point charge is located at the center of the cube, a distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math> from the center of each cube face. A <math alttext="negative 3.0 nanocoulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>−</mo><mn>3.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>nC</mtext></math> point charge is outside the cube, the same distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math> from one of the cube faces. What is the magnitude of the total electric flux through the cube?

choices.label: <math alttext="56 newton meters squared per coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>56</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">·</mo><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>/</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>

<math alttext="340 newton meters squared per coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>340</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">·</mo><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>/</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>

<math alttext="680 newton meters squared per coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>680</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">·</mo><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>/</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="340 newton meters squared per coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>340</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">·</mo><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>/</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
